column5: I just picked up a the Pro Action Classic Suit and am wondering what to expect.  Anyone have a set of these?  The technology seems good and I really like freedom in my movements, at least inside the house anyways
I love my Frogg Toggs!!!  .. and when they wear out I will be buying a second set!
Their Road Toads fell apart the first time I wore it on my motorcycle, I wasn't impressed.

I have a set of fogg toggs that I bought off of ebay and they are great. Paper thin litterally and 100% waterproof and surprisingly wind proof as well. They are breathable too which is another plus. I have had them for over a year and worn them many times. I spent about 12 nights pier fishing in June and July this year and wore them each time just to keep the dew from soaking me. Other guys were either freezing or clammy from wearing PVC rain gear. I was pretty comfortable given the conditions.
Not sure thats what thier meant for.   Lots of guys I know have them and swear by them. I like my Viking suit.Much heavier,but warm and dry.Just my pref.
Where did you get them????  I thought they were only available in the US, I hope to get a set one of these days, in fact I want the same ones GCD has, love the color....  Maureen
BPS had a blow out about 2 months ago on them.Dirt cheap.
I picked them out in Port Colbourne at the Canal Days Festival.  The companies name is Hilly's Fashions.  I have the phone number if you want me to PM it to you.
frogg toggs are pretty popular down here in the states...............theyve even found there way onto the golf course.

I got a set' when I bought a minn kota motor as a promotional item. I've had them for 5 years and they are pretty well worn out but they are great. I am definately buying another pair next year. For the price they have served me well and I picked up a set for the wife last year. I got mine at cabelas for the wife.
I got a set fro Monique after we saw the set that GCD had at Lakair.. she loves them!!
Whenever I've been to BPS they haven't had them...I'll keep a closer watch for them...  Maureen
